These are our values. 

This is why we fight.

1463522892176666632.text: We value our environment, and are using reconciliation to make the single largest investment in the fight against climate change in history.

1463522890868039691.text: We value the health and wellbeing of the American people, and are using reconciliation to expand access to vital health services (particularly for seniors) and to lower the cost of care across the board.

1463522887915249667.text: We value American children and their parents, and are using reconciliation to drastically lower child care costs and provide access to preschool for every kid.

1463522886904336391.text: We value working Americans, and are using reconciliation to cut their taxes—not the super-rich.

1412434111122313222.text:
There’s no question that Donald J. Trump lit this flame. 

But, as we reflect on that wretched day six months later,  never forget that it was Republicans in Congress who handed him the match.

1412434110166056961.text:
With our own eyes, we saw Trump whip a crowd of his supporters into a frenzy and urge them to march to the Capitol. With our own ears, we heard Rudy Giuliani tell them to engage in a "trial by combat." 

The mob was given orders, and the world watched as they carried them out.

1412434109255856134.text: I will not mince words about that nightmare. The siege of the US Capitol was an act of violent insurrection against a coequal branch of the federal government, incited by a president desperate for power and incapable of coping with perceived humiliation or defeat.

1412434108458979338.text: Tragically, a rioter pushing her way through that same broken window was shot and killed several moments later.

1412434107485900806.text: As we left for a secure location through the Speaker's Lobby, I turned and saw another makeshift barricade had been erected. I looked up and through smashed glass saw a second faction of the mob attempting to force their way onto the floor from the front of the Chamber.

1412434106542080003.text: We were evacuated from the Chamber as the mob smashed through the windows and attempted to break down the doors at the main entrance to the floor -- the same doors presidents are ushered through to deliver State of the Union addresses.

1412434105657171971.text: Speaker Pelosi and others were rushed off the floor while the Sergeant at Arms locked the chamber doors and instructed members to don the gas masks kept under our seats in case of a chemical attack. With weapons drawn, Capitol Police used furniture to barricade the doors.

1412434104767942656.text: On Wednesday, January 6 I arrived at the Capitol for the counting of the Electoral College votes. I was on the House floor when the building was breached and the House Chamber was placed into lockdown.

1390427885987680256.text:
The Protecting America’s Wilderness and Public Lands Act.
The Stronger Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act.
The NO BAN Act. 
The Access to Counsel Act. 
The Violence Against Women Act.

The list goes on. And it will only keep growing until we #EliminateTheFilibuster.

1390427885048107011.text:
🇺🇸 #DCStatehood

Washington, DC has a larger population than two states, and its 712,000+ residents pay a higher tax rate per capita than any other state in America — yet have no Federal representation.

1390427884007968768.text:
💵 The Paycheck Fairness Act.

On average, Black women make 63 cents on the dollar a white man makes. For Native women, it’s 60 cents and for Latinas, it’s 55 cents. The Paycheck Fairness Act guarantees that women across the workforce are finally paid their fair share.

1390427882938413056.text:
🚫 Gun Control.

The House has passed bills to expand background checks on all gun purchases and to close the Charleston loophole, which carelessly restricts the period of time the FBI has to conduct a background check to three days — allowing many buyers to evade them.

1390427882028208130.text:
👩‍🏭 The PRO Act.

Puts power back into the hands of workers and restores fairness to the economy by strengthening the federal laws that protect workers’ right to join a union — allowing them to organize for better pay, benefits, and working conditions.

1390427881071955971.text:
🏳️‍🌈 The Equality Act.

Guarantees full civil rights to LGBTQ+ individuals so no person can be discriminated against — in employment, housing, health care, education, and more — on the basis of their sexual preferences or gender identity.

1390427880128143360.text:
🦋 The Dream and Promise Act.

Protects Dreamers from deportation and establishes a pathway to citizenship for millions of people who came to America at an early age.

1390427879146655747.text:
⚖️ The George Floyd Justice in Policing Act.

Reimagines American policing by banning chokeholds, establishing a police misconduct registry,  reforming qualified immunity, ending the militarization of law enforcement, and investing money into Black and brown communities.

1390427878203043842.text:
🗳️ H.R. 1, the For the People Act. 

Takes on voter suppression efforts, gets big money OUT of politics,  returns the power in our democracy to the people, protects and expands voting rights to ensure that every voice is heard and every vote is counted.

1297901123454541825.text: What leader would take steps to freeze overtime for a workforce literally risking its lives every day to deliver mail to the people of this nation — and struggling to find enough capacity to get it done?

1297901122510675968.text: What leader would think that even the possibility of slowing down mail in a time of such crisis is a good idea?

1297901121739137025.text:

Yet he felt confident enough to freeze overtime, delay mail delivery, and propose a massive reorganization plan.

1297901121101541376.text:

He announces these changes without engaging staff, unions, trade organizations, or Congress.

1297901120371732480.text: We have a Postmaster General who, six weeks into a new job — in the midst of a global pandemic and just weeks before a contentious presidential election where the Postal Service will pay an unprecedented role — decides to announce a sweeping reorganization.

1268585414660669441.text:
Congress must act. We have legislation ready now, and we have more on the way.

This is a rare moment of stark right and wrong. I urge @senatemajldr McConnell, and all my Republican colleagues, to think long and hard before choosing a side.

1268585413918298113.text: 8. @RepRoKhanna's PEACE Act, which would change the use of force standard for federal officers to require that force must be necessary, as a last resort, to prevent imminent death or serious bodily injury.

1268585413138157568.text: 7. @RepJasonCrow's Law Enforcement Trust and Integrity Act, which provides incentives for local police departments to voluntarily adopt performance-based standards to minimize incidents of misconduct, improve operations and enhance community accountability.

1268585412257132544.text: 6. @RepGwenMoore's Preventing Tragedies Between Police and Communities Act requires a state or local government that receives funding under the JAG program to train law enforcement officers on de-escalation techniques and require law enforcement to use such techniques.

1268585411279978498.text: 5. And his Police Training and Independent Review Act, which authorizes the DOJ to award grants to States that require law enforcement officers to be trained on ethics and racial bias, cultural diversity, and police interaction with the disabled, mentally ill, and new immigrants.

1268585410558656513.text: 4. @RepCohen's National Statistics on Deadly Force Transparency Act, which would require federal, state, and local law enforcement agencies to collect and publish data on the use of deadly force by law enforcement officers.

1268585409757491202.text: 3. @RepJeffries' Eric Garner Excessive Use of Force Prevention Act, which makes the use of chokeholds by law enforcement unlawful through an amendment to civil rights statute.

1268585409132613635.text: 2. @JacksonLeeTX18's End Racial Profiling Act, which prohibits federal, state, and local law enforcement from racial profiling.

1268585408289558541.text: 1. @RepHankJohnson's Stop Militarizing Law Enforcement Act, which would end the transfers of certain military equipment to local law enforcement. In 2017 President Trump fully restored DOD's program that transferred more than $6 billion in military equipment to our streets.
